block.p: Alissa Toby Raphaelson, the daughter of Susan and Ralph B. Raphaelson of Dix Hills, N.Y., was married last evening to David Harvey Sukoff, a son of Arlene and Steven K. Sukoff of Melville, N.Y. Rabbi Marc A. Gellman performed the ceremony at Temple Beth Torah in Melville.
The couple are students at the New York University College of Dentistry, where the bride is about to begin her fourth year and the bridegroom his third.

Alissa Toby Raphaelson, the daughter of Susan and Ralph B. Raphaelson of Dix Hills, N.Y., was married last evening to David Harvey Sukoff, a son of Arlene and Steven K. Sukoff of Melville, N.Y. Rabbi Marc A. Gellman performed the ceremony at Temple Beth Torah in Melville.
The couple are students at the New York University College of Dentistry, where the bride is about to begin her fourth year and the bridegroom his third.

The bride, 25, graduated from Lafayette College. Her father is a dentist in Deer Park, N.Y. Her mother is an art therapist in Dix Hills. The bride is a granddaughter of the late Judge Jacob D. Fuchsberg of the New York State Court of Appeals.

The bridegroom, 24, graduated from American University. His mother works in the Half Hollow Hills school district on Long Island, providing job training for special-education students. His father is an owner of the Imperial Paper Box Corporation in Brooklyn, a manufacturer of packaging for compact discs and videocassettes.
